metadata.dc:author: Lerma, Juan José
Lozano, Antonio
Belmonte, Miguel Angel
Tejón, Patricia
metadata.dc:description: Coccydynia is a syndrome that rheumatologists encounter frequently in the form of tailbone pain, which is usually worse when sitting. Although the most common origin is trauma, there are several other possible causes of pain in the coccyx. We present an unusual case in which coccydynia developed shortly after the insertion of a contraceptive vaginal ring and remitted completely upon removal of this system.
metadata.dc:subject: Coccydynia
Anillo vaginal anticonceptivo
Coccigodinia
Contraceptive vaginal ring
metadata.dc:title: Coccigodinia relacionada con uso de anillo vaginal anticonceptivo.
Coccydynia related to the use of a contraceptive vaginal ring.
